intro: Linzia nigritiana, commonly known as the black nightshade, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant features small, dark purple to black berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Its leaves are ovate with a hairy texture, and it typically grows in dry, rocky environments. Linzia nigritiana is often found in arid regions and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
